headline: Will Analog Devices’ (ADI) Special Meeting Stance Reveal Its True Governance and Accountability Priorities?
summary: On February 9, 2026, Analog Devices, Inc. told shareholders it had received a proposal to change special meeting rights and urged them to vote against it, arguing its existing 25% threshold already offers meaningful access while limiting potential misuse by a small minority. The company framed its position as aligned with public company best practices, linking its current special meeting framework to board accountability and an emphasis on long term shareholder value. We’ll now examine how...
